no-autoplay-audio:
<video controls autoplay muted loop preload="auto" width="640" height="360">
  <source src="example.mp4" type="video/mp4">
  Your browser does not support the video tag.
</video>

This video element has the autoplay attribute, but it also has the controls attribute which allows the user to pause, play, and adjust the volume of the video. Additionally, the muted attribute ensures that the video does not play with sound unless the user manually unmutes it. The loop attribute ensures that the video will play continuously. The preload attribute ensures that the video will start playing as soon as possible. Finally, the width and height attributes provide dimensions for the video player. 

To limit the autoplay to 3 seconds, JavaScript can be used to pause the video after 3 seconds. For example:

<video controls autoplay muted loop preload="auto" width="640" height="360" onloadedmetadata="setTimeout(function(){this.pause();}, 3000);">
  <source src="example.mp4" type="video/mp4">
  Your browser does not support the video tag.
</video>

The onloadedmetadata attribute triggers a JavaScript function that pauses the video after 3 seconds. This ensures that the video does not autoplay for more than
